title: Analytical Chemistry Specialist - AI Trainer
description_raw: {"analytical chemistry specialist - ai trainer": "Are you an analytical chemistry expert eager to shape the future of AI? Large‐scale language models are evolving from clever chatbots into powerful engines of scientific discovery. With high‐quality training data, tomorrow’s AI can democratize world‐class education, keep pace with cutting‐edge research, and streamline lab work for scientists everywhere. That training data begins with you—we need your expertise to help power the next generation of AI. We’re looking for analytical chemistry specialists who live and breathe spectroscopy, chromatography, electrochemical analysis, quantitative chemical analysis, environmental testing, pharmaceutical analysis, and analytical method development. You’ll challenge advanced language models on topics like mass spectrometry, HPLC and GC technique optimization, NMR interpretation, method validation, trace analysis, titrimetric methods, and QA/QC protocol design—documenting every failure mode so we can harden model reasoning. On a typical day, you will converse with the model on lab scenarios and theoretical analytical chemistry questions, verify factual accuracy and logical soundness, capture reproducible error traces, and suggest improvements to our prompt engineering and evaluation metrics. A PhD in analytical chemistry or a closely related chemical science field is ideal; peer‐reviewed publications, lab-based method development, regulatory testing, or instrumentation-intensive research signal fit. Clear, metacognitive communication—“showing your work”—is essential. Ready to turn your analytical chemistry expertise into the knowledge base for tomorrow’s AI? Apply today and start teaching the model that will teach the world. We offer a pay range of $8‐to‐$65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor you’ll supply a secure computer and high‐speed internet; company‐sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply. title: Health Sciences Specialist – AI Trainer
description_raw: {"health sciences specialist – ai trainer": "Are you a health sciences expert eager to shape the future of AI? Large‐scale language models are evolving from clever chatbots into powerful engines of scientific discovery. With high‐quality training data, tomorrow’s AI can democratize world‐class education, keep pace with cutting‐edge research, and streamline clinical workflows for health professionals everywhere. That training data begins with you—we need your expertise to help power the next generation of AI. We’re looking for health sciences specialists who live and breathe human anatomy, physiology, epidemiology, healthcare systems, clinical diagnostics, pharmacology, nutrition, and public health. You’ll challenge advanced language models on topics like disease prevention, health promotion, clinical decision-making, evidence-based medicine, patient safety protocols, and healthcare ethics—documenting every failure mode so we can harden model reasoning. On a typical day, you will converse with the model on clinical scenarios and theoretical health science questions, verify factual accuracy and logical soundness, capture reproducible error traces, and suggest improvements to our prompt engineering and evaluation metrics. A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Health Sciences, Public Health, Nursing, or a related healthcare field is ideal; clinical experience, healthcare research, or teaching in health-related disciplines signals fit. Clear, metacognitive communication—“showing your work”—is essential. Ready to turn your health sciences expertise into the knowledge base for tomorrow’s AI? Apply today and start teaching the model that will teach the world. We offer a pay range of $8-to- $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor you’ll supply a secure computer and high‐speed internet; company‐sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply.
